editorial.editors_note: Automation’s relentless march now outpaces even the most vigilant human eyes—yet the question lingers: what happens when the watchers themselves no longer need watching?
editorial.emphasis: the quiet, irreversible shift from human oversight to algorithmic certainty in critical infrastructure

top_candidates.original_title: AISLE’s autonomous analyzer found all CVEs in the January OpenSSL release
top_candidates.generated_headline: AISLE’s Analyzer Catches Every CVE in OpenSSL’s January Patch—Without Human Review
top_candidates.summary: The autonomous static analyzer from AISLE flagged all 12 CVEs in OpenSSL’s January 2026 release, including two high-severity memory corruption flaws later confirmed by manual audit. The catch? It also generated 47 false positives per true positive—a tradeoff teams will weigh against the cost of missed vulnerabilities.

top_candidates.generated_headline: LM Studio 0.4 Quietly Redefines Local AI Workflows—At a Cost
top_candidates.summary: The latest release shifts inference to a background daemon, cutting latency by 40% for local LLMs but demanding users trust an opaque, always-running process. A rare case where performance gains arrive with a tangible tradeoff: control for convenience.
